WorkItem.Description:
I was busy with the optimizer, and part of the optimizations I was busy with were talents.
Unfortunately, I made a mistake and clicked the "optimize" button by accident without selecting anything from the required drop-down field next to the talents. This caused Rawr to produce an error with the attached exception message, and it crashed the program (the program crashed after I managed to get the data copied to the clipboard).
Â 
A possible fix might be to put in a check to see that the user has selected an appropriate field when the talents are being optimized? I know that it is the user's fault for the crash, but it might help save some people frustration especially if they were busy with the program for awhile.

Comments.Message: Do you mean you set up (or were trying to set up) a talent requirement for the optimizer and before you actually selected the talent you clicked optimize so it crashed?
Yes, I accidentally clicked "optimize" before selecting the required talent from the combo box. I will give you a screenshot to explain what I mean.

Fixed for next version. Changed it so when you select talent requirement it auto-selects the first talent instead of staying blank. Will blank out when you select away from it, this way it's impossible to start an optimize with an empty box
Awesome :) might save some people (like me) from our own clumsy mistakes
